Boris Johnson’s government has had 12 years to end the UK’s reliance on imported fossil fuels. 

They chose not to. 

Labour would turbocharge the shift to cheap, clean, home-grown renewables and nuclear energy. https://t.co/s8vyphIilp

MSMEs are the backbone of Indian economy and will play a crucial role in accelerating India towards self-reliance. 

PM Shri @narendramodi’s govt. has approved ₹6,062.45 crore for rolling-out the World Bank assisted #RAMP scheme to revitalise the MSME sector. https://t.co/qkMwOCYS9M

The choice to reject Russian gas comes at a high cost. It will bring pain to many.

It is nevertheless the right choice.

This moment is an opportunity we must not miss to break our self-destructive reliance on fossil fuels—and to stop bankrolling petrostate autocrats. https://t.co/negEYoPDCz

The IOC will release 6,000 metric tonnes of diesel to #SriLanka as it pitches in to mitigate the spike in power cuts in the island nation, which is facing an unprecedented economic and energy crisis, officials in #Colombo said.
